name: Alakazam
flavorText: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Blastoise
flavorText: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high-speed tackles.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokémon. (This doesn't use up your 1 Energy card attachment for the turn.) This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Chansey
flavorText: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to catch it.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
Attack2Text: Chansey does 80 damage to itself.

name: Charizard
flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

name: Clefable
flavorText: A timid Fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefable's type is still Colorless.)
Attack2Text: All damage done by attacks to Clefable during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Clefairy
flavorText: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefairy's type is still Colorless.)

name: Gyarados
flavorText: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Hitmonchan
flavorText: While seeming to do nothing, it fires punches in lightning-fast volleys that are impossible to see.

name: Magneton
flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. It frequently appears when sunspots flare up.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 80 damage to itself.

name: Mewtwo
flavorText: A scientist created this Pokémon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Mewtwo in order to use this attack. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo.

name: Nidoking
flavorText: Uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break its prey's bones.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

name: Nidoqueen
flavorText: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

name: Ninetales
flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales in order to use this attack.

name: Pidgeot
flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.
Attack2Text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

name: Poliwrath
flavorText: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwrath but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

name: Raichu
flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

name: Scyther
flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of it.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

name: Venusaur
flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Wigglytuff
flavorText: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Zapdos
flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon said to appear from clouds while wielding enormous lightning bolts.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos in order to use this attack.

name: Beedrill
flavorText: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Dragonair
flavorText: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

name: Dugtrio
flavorText: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Electabuzz
flavorText: Normally found near power plants, it can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

name: Electrode
flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.
Ability1Text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokémon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card of that type (instead of a Pokémon) that provides 2 energy. This power can't be used if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.

name: Kangaskhan
flavorText: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is three years old.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Mr. Mime
flavorText: If interrupted while miming, it will slap around the enemy with its broad hands.
Ability1Text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 30 or more damage to Mr. Mime (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Mr. Mime is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Pidgeotto
flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Pinsir
flavorText: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing its victim around and toss it hard.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Snorlax
flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.
Ability1Text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Snorlax is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Venomoth
flavorText: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change the type of Venomoth to the type of any other Pokémon in play other than Colorless. This power can't be used if Venomoth is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

name: Victreebel
flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your next turn.

name: Arcanine
flavorText: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.
Attack1Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack.
Attack2Text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

name: Butterfree
flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Butterfree has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Charmeleon
flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it raises the temperature to unbearably high levels.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon in order to use this attack.

name: Dewgong
flavorText: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Dodrio
flavorText: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.
Ability1Text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

name: Dratini
flavorText: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

name: Exeggutor
flavorText: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.
Attack1Text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Farfetch'd
flavorText: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. This sprig is used much like a metal sword.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).

name: Fearow
flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

name: Haunter
flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: You can't use this attack unless the Defending Pokémon is Asleep.

name: Ivysaur
flavorText: When the bulb on its back grows large, the Pokémon seems to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Jynx
flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Kadabra
flavorText: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.
Attack1Text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

name: Kakuna
flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Lickitung
flavorText: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a stinging sensation when it licks enemies.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Machoke
flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.
Attack1Text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.
Attack2Text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

name: Magikarp
flavorText: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

name: Magmar
flavorText: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magmar in order to use this attack.

name: Marowak
flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to K.O. targets.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for a Fighting Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

name: Nidorina
flavorText: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Nidorino
flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Parasect
flavorText: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Persian
flavorText: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Persian during your next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

name: Poliwhirl
flavorText: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Raticate
flavorText: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It seems to slow down if they are cut off.
Attack2Text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

name: Rhydon
flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.
Attack2Text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon. Switch the Pokémon even if Rhydon is knocked out.)

name: Seaking
flavorText: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

name: Seel
flavorText: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. This horn is used for bashing through thick ice.

name: Tauros
flavorText: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused (after doing damage).

name: Wartortle
flavorText: Often hides in water to stalk unweary prey. When swimming quickly, it moves its ears to maintain balance.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Wartortle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Weepinbell
flavorText: It spits out poisonpowder to immobilize the enemy, and then finishes the enemy with a spray of acid.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Abra
flavorText: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Bellsprout
flavorText: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Bellsprout and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

name: Bulbasaur
flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. Thus, a plant sprouted and now grows with this Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

name: Caterpie
flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Charmander
flavorText: Obviously prefers hot places. If it gets caught in the rain, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmander in order to use this attack.

name: Cubone
flavorText: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this Pokémon's real face.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Cubone during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Cubone.

name: Diglett
flavorText: Lives about three feet underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

name: Doduo
flavorText: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Drowzee
flavorText: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Exeggcute
flavorText: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Exeggcute.

name: Gastly
flavorText: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Gastly in order to use this attack. If a Pokémon Knocks Out Gastly during your opponent's next turn, Knock Out that Pokémon.

name: Goldeen
flavorText: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname "Water Queen."

name: Jigglypuff
flavorText: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Machop
flavorText: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses attacks like Thunder Wave.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

name: Meowth
flavorText: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

name: Metapod
flavorText: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Nidoran ♀
flavorText: Although small, its venomous barbs make this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Nidoran ♂ or Nidoran ♀ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

name: Nidoran ♂
flavorText: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger, more powerful of its horns secretes venom.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Onix
flavorText: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Paras
flavorText: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Pidgey
flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

name: Pikachu
flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can cause lightning storms.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

name: Poliwag
flavorText: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming over trying to stand.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwag but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Rattata
flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

name: Rhyhorn
flavorText: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Rhyhorn during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

name: Sandshrew
flavorText: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Spearow
flavorText: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speeds to stay airborne.
Attack2Text: If Spearow was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Spearow to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Squirtle
flavorText: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of opponent's attacks still happen.)

name: Starmie
flavorText: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value this core as a gem.
Attack1Text: Discard 1 Water Energy card attached to Starmie in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Starmie.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Staryu
flavorText: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

name: Tangela
flavorText: Its whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. These vines shake as it walks.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Venonat
flavorText: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venonat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Venonat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. Its tail splits from the tip as it grows older.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Weedle
flavorText: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp, venomous stinger on its head.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
